Evidence: XREF_BIBR Our observation of increased DNA methylation in FRMD4A in whole blood samples from children exposed to maternal smoking is consistent with an experimental study showing hypermethylated FRMD4A in MCF-7 cells treated with benzo (a) pyrene (BaP), a common polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon that is a constituent of cigarette smoke.
